sub_title: Designing and facilitating memorable change processes with mission driven organizations, L.L.M.
summary:
The intersection of leadership, culture and strategy is my field. Designing and facilitating strategic change processes, retreats and learning journey’s for global leaders and organisations is my passion. I also love conducting research and doing the analytical ground work. 

I worked in Egypt and the Middle East for six years, supporting civil society organisations, startups and small and medium businesses in their leadership, effectiveness and growth, providing technical training, seed grants, team development and gaining access to investment. 

Before that I was an advisor to the Dutch public sector, having done projects in parliament, many ministries and educational institutions on dialogue and co-creation processes, research, strategic policy assessments and facilitating think-tank sessions. 

In 2011 I co-founded Sunryse, a foundation that guides young people in their personal leadership and the courage to take their own dreams and imagination seriously. 

I work in Dutch, English and German, and my Egyptian Arabic is slowly but surely getting up to speed.

education.field_of_study: Law and politics of international security

profile_positions.description: Enabling the missions or transformations of purpose driven leaders and organisations. Better Future is a global leadership and strategy consultancy that supports front running companies to grow by empowering senior leaders to discover and connect with their purpose and translate that to their work and into their daily operations.
profile_positions.title: Process designer - facilitator & change maker
Consultant
Facilitor & trainer
Executive Manager
Advisor

profile_positions.description: Gudran is a grass roots NGO using artistic practices as a means for social transformation in local Alexandrian neighbourhoods. I was responsible for implementing an impact measurement system and organising sessions for impact studies. Writing project proposals to funders such as Ford Foundation, Hivos, Stichting DOEN, and Arab Cultural Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Program developer/facilitator

profile_positions.description: My work entailed bringing diverse student groups together through organising seminars, festivals, and workshops on topics fostering real connection and dialogue between cultures. I was responsible for organising and leading a ‘dialogue journey’ to Israel and the Palestinian territories with 25 students. We also provided policy advice for diversity related topics at the University.
profile_positions.title: Beleidsassistent diversiteit & studiesucces

volunteer_experiences.description:
We founded Sunryse to learn about creative facilitation and leadership. As course director and content developer I design experimental and experiential retreats on topics that fascinate me, ranging from  'systems dynamics’ to 'purpose finding' or cultivating deep conversations with yourself.

Sunryse is a foundation established to create facilitated space for exploration around leadership awareness, living a joyful life and creating a positive impact in our world. We bring together curious people that are willing to learn, explore and grow compassion for themselves, others and the world.

company.name: Rastriya Seva Samithi (RASS), Tirupati Area, India

volunteer_experiences.description: Before learning about the world in theory, I wanted to learn about the world in practice. After high school I volunteered for a year at RASS in South India. One of the best choices I have ever made. It was an intense year of learning, gaining profound perspectives on culture, the pace of change, what development means and does not mean, laughing, crying, being home sick, teaching English to classes to 100+ wonderfully behaved kids. Learning a beautiful but rather useless language and how to tie a sari in three minutes.
